page.title: 09POULTON AS A SHOPPING CENTRE
page.content: Poulton-le-Fylde is an old market town of 17,666 people. In recent years the shopping centre has changed to serve the population of the town and the shoppers from nearby rural areas. The old centre around the church,which is now pedestrianised, still contains the stocks and fishslabs of the old market. In 1974 the Teanlowe Indoor Shopping Centre was developed, incorporating a library, bus terminal, main Post Office and Public Toilets. Large free car parking areas nearby are accessible by a one-way system which also allows the movement of through traffic. There is a variety of food shops in the town, including four supermarkets and many grocers and butchers. There are several household goods stores and branches of all the main banks and building societies.
